metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: Gigamon Connector data connector with template version 3.0.0

connectorUiConfig.title: Gigamon Data Connector
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: Use this data connector to integrate with Gigamon Application Metadata Exporter (AMX) and get data sent directly to Microsoft Sentinel.

dataTypes.name: Gigamon_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Gigamon_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
Gigamon_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description:
1. Application Metadata Exporter (AMX) application converts the output from the Application Metadata Intelligence (AMI) in CEF format into JSON format and sends it to the cloud tools and Kafka.
 2. The AMX application can be deployed only on a V Series Node and can be connected to Application Metadata Intelligence running on a physical node or a virtual machine.
 3. The AMX application and the AMI are managed by GigaVUE-FM. This application is supported on VMware ESXi, VMware NSX-T, AWS and Azure.
instructionSteps.title: Gigamon AMX Data Connector

connectorUiConfig.title: Gigamon Data Connector
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: Use this data connector to integrate with Gigamon Application Metadata Exporter (AMX) and get data sent directly to Microsoft Sentinel.

dataTypes.name: Gigamon_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Gigamon_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
Gigamon_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description:
1. Application Metadata Exporter (AMX) application converts the output from the Application Metadata Intelligence (AMI) in CEF format into JSON format and sends it to the cloud tools and Kafka.
 2. The AMX application can be deployed only on a V Series Node and can be connected to Application Metadata Intelligence running on a physical node or a virtual machine.
 3. The AMX application and the AMI are managed by GigaVUE-FM. This application is supported on VMware ESXi, VMware NSX-T, AWS and Azure.
instructionSteps.title: Gigamon AMX Data Connector

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Gigamon Connector solution provides the capability to ingest Gigamon AMX metadata events into Microsoft Sentinel

Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:

This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in Preview state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs:

  1. Azure Monitor HTTP Data Collector API

Data Connectors: 1, Workbooks: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
